intro: Castilleja tenuiflora var. xylorrhiza, commonly known as the narrow-leaved Indian paintbrush, is a hemiparasitic flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and is characterized by its bright red, orange, or yellow flowers that resemble paintbrushes. The plant has specialized roots that attach to the roots of other plants, allowing it to obtain some of its nutrients. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and forest edges. Its botanical features include narrow leaves and a tall, branching stem that supports its showy floral display.
